Organisation Name: Surrey and Borders Partnership NHS Foundation Trust
Title: Outsourced Internal Audit and Counter Fraud services
Description:
Internal Audit & Local Counter Fraud Services 
Services will be delivered in compliance with Professional Obligations. 

The Trust requires a comprehensive and efficient Internal Audit Service to meet its roles and responsibilities, whilst maintaining the necessary level of professional independence. 
The Contractor must ensure that it can meet the mandatory NHS Internal Audit Standards.
The Contractor must also meet the requirements for the provision of the opinion of the Head of Internal Audit on the Trust's system of Internal Control.
The Trust wishes to agree a strategic internal audit plan covering the three financial years from 1 May 2022. The contract will be for a period of 36 months with an option to extend for up to a further 2x12 months.
When undertaking assignments the Contractor shall review the Trust's systems to ensure that they comply with guidance and directives as issued by the Government, the Independent regulator [NHSE & I formerly Monitor] and Trust's Standing Orders and Standing Financial Instructions and procedures in addition to legal requirements.
The Standing Orders, Standing Financial Instructions shall also be reviewed to ensure completeness and accuracy and lack of conflict with such guidelines and directives as may be issued by the Government, Monitor and legal requirements.

Description
The School of Medicine University of Central Lancashire is seeking applications to tender from agencies able to provide simulated patients, actors or trained clinical role players (SPs) for School of Medicine courses. Your tender should demonstrate how you will address the requirements and critical success factors outlined below.

Purpose

This purpose of this specification is to set the requirements, management and partnership for a single preferred provider that will deliver the Simulated Patient provision across the School of Medicine's clinical courses: MBBS, MPAS, MPAP and other clinical courses UG and PG, as required by curriculum needs.
Please note the term 'Simulated Patient'(SP) is understood to refer to clinical role players or actors who work as simulated patients for teaching purposes and as standardised patients for assessment purposes.

Requirements

The successful Bidder will be able to provide high quality simulated patients for roles in Clinical Skills teaching sessions, Communication Skills teaching sessions and for clinical assessments such as Objective Structured Clinical Examinations (OSCEs) with supportive and responsive management and administrative processes.

Title: Tender for a South Kesteven High Street Digital Application
Description:
South Kesteven District Council wishes to invite tenders for the provision of a mobile app and website to promote all town centres, high streets, and businesses across South Kesteven District.

The COVID19 Pandemic has had unprecedented impact on local town centres and high streets across the Country. HM Government Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities, hereafter referred to as "DULHC") has made funds available to local authorities to support the High Street via the Welcome Back Fund (hereafter referred to as "WBF").

These funds are drawn from the European Regional Development Fund (hereafter referred to as "ERDF"), and the specification outlines how this project will deliver and meet ERDF contractual requirements.

Further information on the requirement and relevant performance standards are available within the Specification.

The anticipated contract commencement date is 7th March 2022.

The Council proposes to enter one contract for an initial period of 3 weeks, with no option to extend. The project must be delivered as per the specification by 31st March 2022.

The budget for this contract is £50,000 in its entirety (exclusive of VAT). Please Note: The Council reserves the right to reject any submissions that are over budget without further evaluation.  

Closing date for the submission of Tenders is 12:00noon on 24th February 2022.

Title: National Fire Chiefs Council: The Development of a National Coaching & Mentoring Portal, Supervisory Leadership Development Portal and Supervisory Leadership Development Programmes for UK Fire & Rescue Services
Description:
National Fire Chiefs Council: The Development of a National Coaching & Mentoring Portal, Supervisory Leadership Development Portal and Supervisory Leadership Development Programmes for UK Fire & Rescue Services
Description :The National Fire Chiefs Council (NFCC) seeking external suppliers who would be interested to develop a National Coaching and Mentoring Portal for the Fire and Rescue Service. This work is being managed and developed by the National Fire Chiefs Council.

In addition to the Coaching and Mentoring Portal we are interested to help shape the activities below, in relation to the introduction of a National Supervisory Leadership Development Programme (SLDP) for the fire & rescue services in the UK. This work is being managed and developed by the National Fire Chiefs Council (NFCC).

The overall purpose for a national supervisory leadership development programme is to achieve tangible behavioural change for supervisory leaders across FRSs, measured against the NFCC Leadership framework and Core Learning Pathways. It is envisaged to deliver leadership development that creates leaders who are people-focused and more trusting, empowering, and encouraging to those that they lead through a leadership style that is collaborative and inclusive.

Our Requirement
The Invitation To Tender comprises of three Lots:

Lot 1 Coaching and Mentoring Portal
Lot 2 Supervisory Leadership Development Portal
Lot 3 Supervisory Leadership Development Programmes

Title: Cambridge City Council - Cleaning for communal areas of council housing
Description:
Cambridge City Council (The Council) requires a supplier to fulfil its building cleaning services for the city, for communal areas of council housing. This element of the City Councils building cleaning requirements is part of its wider cleaning requirements which were tendered and awarded with the contracts starting on the 1st April 20211.
The previous tender used the following five lot structure as follows: 
•	Lot 1: Administration, commercial buildings, community centres and operational buildings (Contracted April 2021)
•	Lot 2: Public toilets (Contracted April 2021)
•	Lot 3: City Homes communal areas and sheltered housing schemes (this procurement exercise)
•	Lot 4: Multi-storey car parks (Contracted April 2021)
•	Lot 5: Window cleaning (Contracted April 2021)
The Council are now proceeding with a new Procurement separate procurement to find a supplier to fulfil building cleaning services for City Homes communal areas and sheltered housing schemes.

Please note this contract includes TUPE. The current contract for Housing Cleaning includes elements that are not included within this tender as such the exact nature of the TUPE requirements and who transfer to whom will not be known until the selection process is complete and the successful tenderer has been identified. The Council will provide TUPE information upon request and the completion of a non-disclosure agreement.
A contract term is initially 3 years, with an option to extend by 2 years then up to 2 further years, if the supplier is performing satisfactorily, and the service can be shown to continue to provide best value to the Council; this gives a maximum possible contract length of 7 years.

Assessment - price: quality tender assessment split of 40% price: 60% quality.

The current contract is due to end on the 31st March 2022 it is not anticipated that this will be extended. The anticipated start date of the new contract is the 1st April 2022.

Title: Procure Plus - Energy Modelling Services
Description:
Procure Plus requires energy modelling consultancy support to aid the delivery of the Homes as  Energy  Systems  project,  which  is  part-funded  by  the European  Regional  Development Funds through the 2014-2020 England Operational Programme. The HAES project started on 01 October 2018 and is expected to finish on 31 December 2022.

HAES is delivering an estimated 700 retrofit interventions with the aim to increase the energy efficiency in the housing sector and decrease the annual emissions of Green House Gases (GHG) by 2,350 tonnes of CO2e in the Greater Manchester region. All interventions have been identified  and  comprise  of  a  predetermined  set  of  capital  works  that  include  ground  source heat pumps, air source heat pumps, photovoltaic systems, batteries, external wall insulation and deep energy demand reduction retrofit. 

Procure Plus is the accountable body for a multimillion-pound European Regional Development Fund (ERDF) funded project, Homes as Energy Systems (HAES).A critical element of this project centres on the aggregation and control of energy stores, both electrical battery systems (a small number) and a combination of Ground Source Heat Pumps (GSHP) and Air Source Heat Pumps (ASHP).

A named project Delivery Partner, KrakenFlow (owned by OctopusEnergy), is responsible for defining overall architecture and communications protocols between its cloud service and the energy storage assets as well as gathering data from and sending control signals to the assets, batteries and heat pumps.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Power Circle Projects Limited|17 Kenilworth Road, Bridge Of Allan, Stirling, Scotland, FK9 4DU|COMPANIES_HOUSE|SC663219|Yes|No]

Organisation Name: NHS SOUTH, CENTRAL AND WEST COMMISSIONING SUPPORT UNIT
Title: Bath and North East Somerset, Swindon and Wiltshire Clinical Commissioning Group - Community based DVT diagnostic service in Bath and North East Somerset
Description:
Bath and North East, Swindon and Wiltshire Somerset Clinical Commissioning Group (BSWCCG) is going to award a contract to Bath and North East Somerset Enhanced Medical Services (BEMS+) to continue to provide a community based DVT diagnostic service for the population of Bath and North East Somerset who are over the age of 18. 

BEMS+ will continue to deliver a diagnostic service to support practices and the GP out-of-hours service in the management and treatment of DVT.  

The provider will deliver services:  
•	promote the referral mechanism
•	supply near patient D-dimer testing kits to practices and the GP out-of-hours service
•	provide full leg ultrasound scanning in a community location
•	provide training to GPs (General Practice and Out of Hours Service)
•	manage the relationships with General Practice and the Out of Hours Service

BEMS+ provided a good service with strong relationships with other providers including the 24 GP practices, Royal United Hospitals Bath NHS Foundation Trust, the Bath Treatment Centre, Homeless Healthcare Services and non-emergency patient transport services which means that they are best placed to continue providing these services.

The contract has an annualised value of £203,489.  This service will be included in the wider contract with Bath and North East Somerset Enhanced Medical Services (BEMS+) and the service continuation will form part of the annualised review of the contract and the services contained therein.

The Services are healthcare services within the meaning and scope of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015.  The Commissioner has voluntarily advertised this notice of intention to award this contract to reach as wide an audience as possible and to promote transparency and in line with regulation 32(2)(b)(ii).  The Commissioner is firmly of the view that competition is absent for technical reasons, that the organisation listed above are the only provider capable of meeting the CCG's needs within specific localities for the reasons detailed above.
Contact Address 1: Bath and North East Somerset, Swindon and Wiltshire Clinical Commissioning Group
Contact Address 2: Unit E3, Langley Park, Avon Way
Additional Text: The services are healthcare services falling within Schedule 3 to the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 ("the Regulations") which are not subject to the full regime of the Regulations, but is instead governed by the "Light Touch Regime" contained within Chapter 3, Section 7 of the Regulations (Regulations 74 to 77).

Title: IA2441 Community Independence & Integration Support for Unaccompanied Asylum Seeker Children
Description:
This service is for the provision of a Community Independence and Integration Support Service for Staffordshire's Unaccompanied Asylum Seeker Children (UASC) and Refugee Children accepted by Staffordshire County Council as part of the United Kingdom Resettlement Scheme (UKRS).   
    
 This provision will provide support, encouragement and opportunities for Staffordshire's UASC and UKRS Refugee Children population to engage in their community through various community assets in order to benefit the resident community, promote positive outcomes for these young people and achieve community cohesion. The vision is to ensure that all these children and young people have a network of support to help them manage their own challenges, develop robust independence skills and achieve their goals and ambitions to be contributing, positive members of society.

The service will be provided to all UASC and UKRS Refugee Children and on occasion may include children and young people living outside of Staffordshire County. 
    
The Government is also looking to settle Afghan families of Afghan locally employed staff who have previously worked with British forces and British Embassy staff in Afghanistan within the UK. The Council intends to accept Afghan families as part of the Afghan Locally Employed Staff (LES) Relocation Scheme during 2021. Children in these families will also be supported by this service.

Title: 265.4 (Lot 4 of The Deal 2030 Care and Support Ethical Framework) - Extra Care
Description:
Extra Care provides support to enable people to live as independently as possible, including help with day to day living, through direct support, assistive technology equipment and adaptations that can help to make life easier, maintain independence and health and wellbeing.

This wellbeing model builds on the assets of residents and people in the local community to create a home for life for residents, providing care in line with the principles of "just enough support" to enable them to live the best lives they can, deferring or avoiding the need for hospital admissions or a move to more traditional residential care settings. 

Caring and compassionate support is provided by local ethical care providers who are passionate and dedicated to working in an asset-based way ensuring individuals live the life they choose and can fulfil their aims and ambitions. 

We want to work with providers who are experts at proactively maximising community connections; developing relationships; ensuring access to leisure and culture; promoting good health and wellbeing; supporting individuals into volunteering opportunities; and developing people's confidence and independence.

To achieve a transformed model of Extra Care the successful provider will be required to work holistically with individuals to ensure just enough support which is personalised, flexible and responsive. 

The service(s) will be delivered from one or more of seven Schemes within the Borough.

Title: MWF - Yarmouth Fire Station - Kitchen Refurbishment - AWARD
Description:
Dear Sir/Madam,
      
      In accordance with the Hampshire Building Minor Works Framework you are invited to tender for the Kitchen Refurbishment at Yarmouth Fire Station and have been supplied with the attached documents.
